trans-unit.source: Defines values for specifying how the width of a column is adjusted.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control can resize its columns to make them fill the available horizontal width of the control or to make them display the full contents of all cells or of specified cells.

With Fill mode, the preferred width of a column is determined by resizing all columns in that mode so that all visible columns in the control exactly fill the horizontal width of the available display area.

With other modes, the preferred column width is the minimum width required to display the largest cell value from all cells or a subset of cells in that column, such as the subset of cells that are in currently displayed rows.
Using a subset of cells to determine the new width is useful to avoid a performance penalty when working with many rows of data.
Content-based automatic resizing prevents users from adjusting column widths with the mouse.
User resizing is enabled in fill mode, however.

This enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.AutoSizeMode%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.InheritedAutoSizeMode%2A> properties of columns and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.AutoResizeColumn%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

For more information about sizing modes, see [Sizing Options in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/sizing-options-in-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).

For more information about column fill mode in particular, see [Column Fill Mode in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/column-fill-mode-in-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
The column width adjusts to fit the contents of all cells in the column, including the header cell.
The column width adjusts to fit the contents of all cells in the column, excluding the header cell.
The column width adjusts to fit the contents of the column header cell.
The column width adjusts to fit the contents of all cells in the column that are in rows currently displayed onscreen, including the header cell.
The column width adjusts to fit the contents of all cells in the column that are in rows currently displayed onscreen, excluding the header cell.

The column width adjusts so that the widths of all columns exactly fills the display area of the control, requiring horizontal scrolling only to keep column widths above the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.MinimumWidth"></xref> property values.
Relative column widths are determined by the relative <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.FillWeight"></xref> property values.
The column width does not automatically adjust.
The sizing behavior of the column is inherited from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.AutoSizeColumnsMode"></xref> property.
